intro: Paraboea glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which are covered in glandular structures. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. The leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin.
